text: hi everyone banana mango here the
Internet's busiest music nerd and it's
time for review of the new Mastodon
record once more round the Sun a brand
new record from Fame progressive sludge
metal outfit Mastodon you might have
heard their name you might have heard
their music maybe you've heard that
these guys have a super heavy super
impressive back catalogue of complicated
yet accessible metal albums throughout
the 2000s Mastodon was dropping
genre-defining decade defining stuff no
matter what you think have blown out and
however they made one of the most
notable musical shifts of their career
in 2011 with the record the hunter they
made a move toward the accessible with
this record they toned down their
menacing heaviness they harped on some
more melodic clean voiced choruses and
started to dish out some of the most
straightforward Rivet of their career
and Mastodon was not alone in this shift
there were other sludge metal outfits
like Baroness and torch that around the
same time Roche
we're also coming out with the most
accessible albums of their career so
these guys are not the first sludge
metal outfit to go pop but I think they
surpassed pretty much everybody in that
regard with the hunter to the point
where I think the band kind of lost a
bit of their grit and lost me for a
second because the move Mastodon made on
this record it's not usually something a
band just comes back from at least in
the span of a few years anyway however I
was moderately surprised moderately
pleased when Mastodon dropped the first
single from this record high road it
didn't blow me away but I was finally
feeling a bit more positive toward this
catchy er side of Mastodon maybe this
track didn't feature their most crushing
riff ever but it did have a winning
chorus and I was actually surprised to
hear that a lot of the deeper cuts on
this thing hold up to the band manages
to stay catchy straightforward but still
incorporate some progressive complex
interplay and performances Mastodon is
definitely getting better at crafting
more straightforward material that's
actually interesting although it may not
seem like that from the start of the
record tracks like the
opener and highroad though these are
good tracks I do think they kind of
leave once more around the Sun with kind
of a mild beginning the song the mother
lode absolutely my least favorite track
on this entire LP it's like I'm hearing
the worst of alternative rock and new
metal from the 2000s all crashing
together at once on this song the arena
rock vibes are pretty strong with the
title track on this thing would run -
run and features my least favorite vocal
performance of the entire record as well
I'm also pretty disappointed by the
abrupt finish of this track it feels
like it could have gone so much longer
but there are some really impressive
drum fills on this thing a psychedelic
colorful guitar interlude some really
expansive riffs and a pretty epic chorus
and after this track it's like all my
disappointment with this record just
melts away because the band hits a
fantastic stride from the track shines
at night to ember city just nearly to
the end of the album the only major
misstep in between these tracks is the
coat hangers chanted chorus on the song
aunt Lisa which is pretty ridiculous
hey-oh
let's get up and go and rock and roll
it's like listening to a chant the
Ramones rode in a nightmare but again
all the track's in between these two
songs great feast your eyes total barn
burner with some really melodic colorful
guitar leads chimes at night I love the
thunderous and speedy riffs on this
track just the groove of this song I
love it the pace of this track at
freakin rocks
I love the slow melodic outro of this
track - it's a really multifaceted song
I love asleep in the deep one of the
moodier tracks on the entire record
really dreary guitar leads on this thing
but some intense drumming and drum fills
throughout much of the track fantastic
solo at the end of the song - and ember
city I think is the best of the catchy
ER songs that these guys have been
writing the clean voiced chorus on this
thing is just absolutely soaring it's
wonderful it's beautiful it's gorgeous
the lyrics are a little melodramatic but
I think this song is a show of Mastodon
perfecting their catchy ER song
the intro to the song Halloween has
maybe a little bit more of a hard rock
glam rock vibe than I would like but
deeper into the track there are some
guitar passages and riffs that I enjoy
much more and the closer is the longest
and most ambitious song on this entire
record and while it's not maybe the most
romantic thing in the world I do think
it works as a finish I'm not saying this
album is great not saying I love it I
think it's pretty good I think right now
after this record I have a bit more
faith in Mastodon going down this road
if the results are gonna be this
high-quality if we're gonna get tracks
that are as catchy and is blissful and
as exciting as ember city they made
their singles they made their more
straightforward tracks and then they
worked on making some more complex deep
cuts and the final result was a more
well balanced album I'm feeling a strong
6 to a light 7 on this LP transition if
you've given this record to listen what
did you think of it did you love it hate
it why what do you think I should review
next subscribe for justice Mastodon once
more round the Sun blue forever
